qas.question: In what century did trading companies arrive in Tuvalu?
What type of traders did the trading companies employ on Tuvalu?
Who was the first European to permanently settle on Tuvalu?
What trader turned author established a post on Tuvalu?

context: Trading companies became active in Tuvalu in the <a0_0>mid-19th<a0_0/> century; the trading companies engaged <a1_0>palagi traders<a1_0/> who lived on the islands. <a2_0>John (also known as Jack) O'Brien<a2_0/> was the first European to settle in Tuvalu, he became a trader on Funafuti in the 1850s. He married <a3_0>Salai<a3_0/>, the daughter of the paramount chief of Funafuti. <a4_0>Louis Becke<a4_0/>, who later found success as a writer, was a trader on Nanumanga from April 1880 until the trading-station was destroyed later that year in a cyclone. He then became a trader on Nukufetau.
